rounds.category: GET HIM TO THE ANCIENT GREEK

clues.text: The 60 or so works bearing the name of this "Father of Medicine" likely weren't written by him, nor was his oath
After Ptolemy I wished for an easier way to study it, Euclid said, "there is no royal road to" this branch of math
He said, "The unexamined life is not worth living", so let's examine it--he wed Xanthippe & was an Athenian Hoplite soldier
Aeschylus penned the tale of this title Titan, visited by Oceanus & Io... c'mon, you're bound to remember him!
We can give you at least 300 reasons you should know this king of Sparta who headed the Persians off at the pass in 480 B.C.

A sudden rushed or ill-informed type of judgment

____ ____ ____

____ ____

Like the platypus, dinosaurs known as hadrosaurs have this descriptive facial adjective applied to them

From the Latin for "neck", it's the narrow, necklike lower end of the uterus

A poem by him asks, "What happens to a dream deferred? Does it dry up like a raisin in the sun?"
This kid lit classic has a chapter called "The Puppies Arrive"

rounds.category: THAT PLACE USED TO BE CALLED...

clues.text: Until 1784 music out of this city had the Fort Nashborough sound
The Portuguese name for this island was Ilha Formosa, "Beautiful Island"
St. Petersburg was once called Leningrad; similarly, Volgograd was once called by this name
Much of what makes up the Czech Republic today was once this kingdom, which was, oddly, once ruled by the Luxembourg Dynasty
Until 1855 this Western Hemisphere capital city was known as Bytown

rounds.text: A participant in this 1773 event recalled, "Some of our numbers jumped into the hold... I never labored harder in my life"
